text:
Any clues would be appreciated:

`using` certain packages like `Flux` or `CUDA`  on compute node kills Julia. The same doesn't happen on login node or on compute node but for other packages like `PyCall` .

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/57534| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!
Could be because Flux and Cuda depend on an underlying CUDA library?

text: Might be a better question for <#C689Y34LE|gpu>. Maybe it has something to do with your CUDA drivers or your CUDA and Julia versions might be incompatible.
